title: Indoor Air Concentrations of PM2.5 Quartz Fiber Filter-Collected Ionic PFAS and Emissions to Outdoor Air: Findings from the IPA Campaign
content:
Environ. Sci.: Processes Impacts, 2024, Accepted Manuscript
DOI: 10.1039/D4EM00359D, Paper
Naomi Y. Chang, Clara M.A. Eichler, Daniel E Amparo, Jiaqi Zhou, Karsten Baumann, Elaine Hubal, Jason D. Surratt, Glenn Morrison, Barbara J. Turpin
Per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS) are prevalent in consumer products used indoors. However, few measurements of ionic PFAS exist for indoor air. We analyzed samples collected on PM2.5 quartz fiber...
